channel.title: Hatewatch | Southern Poverty Law Center
channel.description: Hatewatch is a blog that monitors and exposes the activities of the American radical right.

item.title: Conspiracy Theories About Pelosi Attack Spread Unchecked on 'Alt-tech' Sites, Conservative Media
item.description: Conspiracy theories about the home invasion and hammer attack on Paul Pelosi, husband of House Speaker Nancy Pelosi, continue to spread across conservative media, social media and “alt-tech” sites, even as a federal criminal complaint appears to debunk false narratives extremists and right-wing influencers have spread.
item.dc:creator: Jason Wilson

item.title: Omaha Police Cancel Deal With Far Right-Linked Gun Shop
item.description: The Omaha Police Department (OPD) in Nebraska confirmed to Hatewatch it has permanently scrapped a proposed equipment swap with a far right-linked gun shop.
item.dc:creator: Creede Newton

item.title: Former ICE Chief Taps Anti-Muslim Hate Group To Help Run Border-Focused Project
item.description: Tom Homan, a former acting director of U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) and prominent conservative media figure, is collaborating with an anti-Muslim hate group on a new project aimed at fearmongering about the U.S. Southern border. The project held a fundraising event at former President Donald Trump’s Mar-a-Lago resort in Florida on Nov. 1.
item.dc:creator: Caleb Kieffer

item.title: Liberty Counsel Used Documents From Gab, ADF for Its Anti-COVID Vaccine Campaign
item.description: The Liberty Counsel (LC) took documents from outside hate groups and hard-right figures to craft religious-based vaccine exemption requests during the COVID-19 pandemic, leaked documents reviewed by Hatewatch appear to show.
item.dc:creator: Creede Newton

item.title: Newsweek Embraces the Anti-Democracy Hard Right
item.description: Newsweek positioned political activist Josh Hammer to run their opinion pages during the runup to the 2020 presidential election, and since that time, the publication has taken a marked radical right turn by buoying extremists and promoting authoritarian leaders.

item.title: Protesters Maced at Canceled Far-right ‘Comedy’ Event at Penn State
item.description: Right-wing agitators allegedly sprayed protesters with mace at a far-right “comedy” event on Penn State’s campus in State College, Pennsylvania, on Monday night.
item.dc:creator: Jason Wilson

item.title: Far-right Student Organization Brings Extremists McInnes, Doyle to Penn State and Tennessee
item.description: Uncensored America (UA), a student organization sanctioned at three university campuses, plans to host Proud Boys founder Gavin McInnes at Penn State University and far-right social media performer John Doyle at the University of Tennessee, Knoxville, in coming weeks.
item.dc:creator: Jason Wilson

item.title: Alex Jones must pay Sandy Hook families almost $1 billion
item.description: The conspiracy theorist and extremist Alex Jones must pay the families of Sandy Hook mass shooting victims almost $1 billion in damages for false claims that they were actors complicit in a hoax.
item.dc:creator: Jason Wilson

item.title: Libertarian Party Loses State Parties, Donors After Hard-right Turn
item.description: The Libertarian Party (LP) faces the departures of two state-level parties as membership dues drop and some donors flee the party over questions about economic stewardship and the party’s turn to far-right messaging, Hatewatch has found through documents and interviews with former LP members.
item.dc:creator: Creede Newton

item.title: Hate Group FAIR Continues To Partner With Sheriffs To Target Immigrants
item.description: A group of sheriffs associated with the extremist constitutional sheriff movement lent their support to the anti-immigrant hate group Federation for American Immigration Reform at a press conference in Washington, D.C., on Friday to promote a “crisis” happening at the Southern border.
item.dc:creator: Caleb Kieffer and Rachel Goldwasser

item.title: Patriot Front Replaces Lawyer of Choice With Extremist
item.description: Patriot Front members have replaced their former first-choice lawyer Brent Gleason with Jason Lee Van Dyke in recent months, according to court documents, leaked chats, sources with knowledge of the group’s internal workings, and online materials reviewed by Hatewatch.
item.dc:creator: Jeff Tischauser and Jason Wilson

item.title: New York Fired Racist Prison Guard for Identity Evropa Membership
item.description: A former corrections officer sought to spread propaganda for a white nationalist group involved with the deadly 2017 “Unite the Right” rally while employed at a New York state prison, Hatewatch found.
item.dc:creator: Hannah Gais and Creede Newton

item.title: White Nationalist Group Exploits Amazon To Fund Their Cause
item.description: The white supremacists behind Antelope Hill, a hate group that churns out books that idealize fascism and denigrate marginalized groups, exploit the low standards for entry of online retailers such as Amazon to run their business.
item.dc:creator: Michael Edison Hayden and Hannah Gais

item.title: Emails Show Omaha Police Planned Deal With Far Right-linked Gun Shop
item.description: The Omaha Police Department (OPD) in Nebraska plans to trade tens of thousands of dollars' worth of expired helmets and bulletproof gear for roughly $3,000 worth of firearm equipment in a deal with a local tactical shop that has hosted international far-right politicians and an anti-Muslim speaker.
item.dc:creator: Creede Newton

item.title: Far-right Extremism and Gun Violence: Reimagining Prevention
item.description: As the U.S. reels from another spate of mass shootings, experts and practitioners concerned with understanding and preventing harms related to extremist radicalization are renewing calls for a more robust system of prevention and support for those at risk.
item.dc:creator: Hannah Gais

item.title: 'Unite the Right' 5 Years Later: Where Are They Now?
item.description: Five years after white supremacists descended on Charlottesville, Virginia, the statue they came to protect is gone, and the “alt-right” coalition they embodied has imploded. At the same time, the existential threat that far-right extremism poses to the U.S. has arguably never been more severe.
item.dc:creator: Michael Edison Hayden, Hannah Gais, Cassie Miller, Megan Squire and Jason Wilson

item.title: How Antigovernment Extremists and QAnon took over the Southern Border
item.description: In Sasabe, Arizona, along the U.S.-Mexico border, far-right Christian nationalists and QAnon adherents have steadily visited the area trying to detain migrants to stop a supposed migrant invasion.
item.dc:creator: Freddy Cruz

item.title: Cadre of Nativist Groups, Figures Have Long Pushed Replacement-by-Immigration Ideas into Mainstream
item.description: For decades, a network of Washington, D.C., nativist groups and their political allies have advanced ideas resembling a “great replacement” spurred on by immigration, as seen in materials associated with the suspect alleged to be responsible for the mass shooting at a Buffalo, New York, supermarket on May 14.
item.dc:creator: Caleb Kieffer

item.title: Andrew Yang To Speak Alongside Far-right Figures at 'FreedomFest'
item.description: Former Democratic presidential candidate Andrew Yang will speak Saturday about his new Forward Party and creating political coalitions at the 2022 FreedomFest in Las Vegas, which will feature far-right libertarians with ties to white nationalists and antisemites.
item.dc:creator: Creede Newton

item.title: Oath Keepers a Threat to Democracy: Jan. 6 Select Committee
item.description: The House committee investigating the events surrounding the Jan. 6, 2021, insurrection focused Tuesday on the Proud Boys and Oath Keepers, two extremist groups involved in the attempt to stop the certification of President Joe Biden’s electoral victory.
item.dc:creator: Creede Newton
